meanings.definition: A toxic colorless or yellowish oily liquid that is the chief active constituent of tobacco.
meanings.sent1: The nicotine in cigarettes can be harmful to your health.
meanings.sent2: She decided to quit smoking to avoid the harmful effects of nicotine.
meanings.sent3: The nicotine in tobacco plants is like a sneaky villain, causing harm without being noticed.
meanings.sent4: His addiction to nicotine was like a dark cloud hanging over his life.
meanings.sent5: The smell of nicotine lingered in the air, a constant reminder of the dangers of smoking.

meanings.definition: A poisonous alkaloid found in tobacco and valued as an insecticide.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use nicotine as a natural insecticide to protect their crops.
meanings.sent2: The presence of nicotine in tobacco makes it harmful if ingested.
meanings.sent3: The insects avoided the nicotine-treated plants, finding them too bitter to eat.
meanings.sent4: The power of nicotine to repel insects is truly remarkable.
meanings.sent5: The nicotine in tobacco leaves serves as a natural defense mechanism against pests.
